question: 0a. B5 Behavioral Assessment: NPI-Q - Form date
0b. B5 Behavioral Assessment: NPI-Q - Examiner's initials
0c. B5 Behavioral Assessment: NPI-Q - Language
0d. B5 Behavioral Assessment: NPI-Q - In-person, remote, or not completed?
0d1. If 'B5 Behavioral Assessment: NPI-Q' form was completed remotely, specify reason
resonse_labels: 1, Too cognitively impaired|2, Too physically impaired|3, Homebound or nursing home|4, Refused in-person visit|5, Other

question: 0d1a. What modality was used to collect this remote 'B5 Behavioral Assessment: NPI-Q' form?
0d2. If 'B5 Behavioral Assessment: NPI-Q' not submitted, specify reason
resonse_labels: 95, Physical problem|96, Cognitive/behavioral problem|97, Other|98, Verbal refusal

question: 1. NPI Co-participant
1a. Co-participant - Other (specify)
2a. Delusions — Does the patient have false beliefs, such as thinking that others are stealing from him/her or planning to harm him/her in some way?
2b. Delusions - Severity
3a. Hallucinations — Does the patient have hallucinations such as false visions or voices? Does he or she seem to hear or see things that are not present?
3b. Hallucinations - Severity
4a. Agitation/aggression — Is the patient resistive to help from others at times, or hard to handle?
4b. Agitation/aggression - Severity
5a. Depression/dysphoria — Does the patient seem sad or say that he/she is depressed?
5b. Depression/dysphoria - Severity

6a. Anxiety — Does the patient become upset when separated from you? Does he/she have any other signs of nervousness such as shortness of breath, sighing, being unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense?
6b. Anxiety - Severity
7a. Elation/euphoria — Does the patient appear to feel too good or act excessively happy?
7b. Elation/euphoria - Severity
8a. Apathy/indifference — Does the patient seem less interested in his/her usual activities or in the activities and plans of others?
8b. Apathy/ indifference - Severity
9a. Disinhibition — Does the patient seem to act impulsively, for example, talking to strangers as if he/she knows them, or saying things that may hurt people’s feelings?
9b. Dishinibition - Severity
10a. Irritability/lability — Is the patient impatient and cranky? Does he/she have difficulty coping with delays or waiting for planned activities?
10b. Irritatbility/lability - Severity
11a. Motor disturbance — Does the patient engage in repetitive activities such as pacing around the house, handling buttons, wrapping string, or doing other things repeatedly?
11b. Motor disturbance - Severity
12a. Nighttime behaviors — Does the patient awaken you during the night, rise too early in the morning, or take excessive naps during the day?
12b. Nighttime behaviors - Severity
13a. Appetite/eating — Has the patient lost or gained weight, or had a change in the type of food he/she likes?
13b. Appetite/eating - Severity
